definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
to chew/also pr. [jue2]
(negative prefix)/not/no
soft/mushy/well-cooked and soft/to rot/to decompose/rotten/worn out/chaotic/messy/utterly/thoroughly/crappy/bad

sentences.english: I think he has too much on his plate right now.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他真的是贪多嚼不烂。

sentences.english: India's richest man may have bitten off more than he can chew.
sentences.chinese: 印度首富可能有咬掉超过他贪多嚼不烂。

sentences.english: A:  I think he has too much on his plate right now.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他真的是贪多嚼不烂。

sentences.english: It is possible that the company is biting off more growth than it can chew.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司可能会是胃口太大，贪多嚼不烂。

definition: lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
extensive but not refined (idiom); to know something about everything/jack-of-all-trades, master of none
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
see 藝多不壓身|艺多不压身[yi4 duo1 bu4 ya1 shen1]
banging away clumsily in all directions with no overall vision
pinyin: dong1 yi1 lang2 tou2 xi1 yi1 bang4 zi5

definition: it's always good to have more skills (idiom)
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

definition: easy to grasp but difficult to put into practice (idiom)/easier said than done
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
